Java Puzzle #8: Interfaces and Visibility

09 Aug 2012

What is the output of the following snippets:

Shape.java: [java]public interface Shape { public void draw(); private void calculateArea(); public void printArea(); }[/java]

Rectangle.java [java]public class Rectangle implements Shape {

private final int x1, x2, y1, y2;
private int area;

public Rectangle(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2) {
    this.x1 = x1;
    this.x2 = x2;
    this.y1 = y1;
    this.y2 = y2;
}

@Override
public void calculateArea() {
    area = Math.abs((x1 - x2) * (y1 - y2));
}

@Override
public void draw() {
    // TODO Auto-generated method stub
}

@Override
public void printArea() {
    calculateArea();
    System.out.println("My area is " + area + ".");
}

}[/java]

test.java: [java]public class test { public static void main(String[] args) { Shape s = new Rectangle(0, 0, 1, 1); s.printArea(); } }[/java]

. . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Answer

[bash]My area is 1.[/bash]

Explanation

Interfaces may not implement anything. So it makes no sense to define private methods. Nevertheless it seems to be valid Java code.
